Usage Guide
===========

This section provides an overview of how to use the project.

Getting Started
---------------

This section covers how to get started with the project, including installation and a basic example.

Installation
^^^^^^^^^^^^

To install the project, you can use pip:

.. code-block:: shell

    pip install my_project

Basic Example
^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Here is a basic example to help you get started:

.. code-block:: python

    from my_project import main_function

    result = main_function()
    print(result)

Main Features
-------------

This section provides an overview of the main features of the project, with examples.

Feature 1: Description
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Here is how to use Feature 1:

.. code-block:: python

    from my_project import feature_1

    feature_1.do_something()

Feature 2: Description
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Here is how to use Feature 2:

.. code-block:: python

    from my_project import feature_2

    feature_2.perform_action()

Advanced Usage
--------------

This section covers more advanced usage of the project, including configuration options and extending the project.

Configuration
^^^^^^^^^^^^^

You can configure the project by setting the following options:

.. code-block:: python

    from my_project import configure

    configure(option1=True, option2='value')

Extending the Project
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

To extend the project, you can create your own modules and integrate them as follows:

.. code-block:: python

    from my_project import extend

    class MyExtension(extend.BaseExtension):
        def new_method(self):
            pass

    my_extension = MyExtension()
    my_extension.new_method()

FAQs
----

Here are some frequently asked questions and their answers.

Q1: How do I install additional dependencies?
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

A1: You can install additional dependencies using pip:

.. code-block:: shell

    pip install additional_package

Q2: How do I report a bug?
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

A2: You can report bugs by opening an issue on the project's GitHub repository.

.. _additional_resources:

Additional Resources
--------------------

For more information, check out the following resources:

- `Project Homepage <https://example.com>`_
- `API Documentation <api.html>`_
- `GitHub Repository <https://github.com/username/repository>`_
